emotecraft.options.keybind: Set a key to play the selected emote.
emotecraft.options.fastmenu: Select an emote, then click on
emotecraft.options.fastmenu2: the emote wheel to add it.
emotecraft.options.fastmenu3: Right click an emote on the wheel to clear it.
emotecraft.sure2:
Another emote already has this keybind.
Do you want to overwrite that emote with this?
emotecraft.otherconfig.validate.tooltip:
Mainly intended for PvP worlds.

Disallows emotes that offset the player too much.
emotecraft.otherconfig.validationThresho: How much offset is too much.
emotecraft.otherconfig.stopthreshold.too:
(0.22 is walking speed)

With a large enough value, the emote won't stop. In that case make sure a key is bound to 'Stop playing emote.'
emotecraft.otherconfig.yratio.tooltip: How much Y-Axis movement is likely to stop an emote. A bigger value means a greater likelyhood.
emotecraft.otherconfig.loadbuiltin.toolt: If you want to remove these for some reason...
emotecraft.otherconfig.playersafety.tool: Won't show emotes from muted players. (1.16.4+)
emotecraft.otherconfig.prespective_redux: Only active when 3rd person perspective is enabled.
emotecraft.otherconfig.enableNSFW.toolti:
(Not Safe For Work)

Allows for potentially inappropriate content.

May contain nudity, intense sexuality, violence or other potentially disturbing subject matter.
emotecraft.otherconfig.alwaysValidateEmo:
Client side option; won't affect internal server.

By default, client-side validation only happens when receiving an emote from an untrusted proxy.
Use this to always do client-side validation.
These options are unstable or not meant to be used without programming knowledge
Most of these are for testing.
emotecraft.otherconfig.emotesFolderOnLog: (DO NOT TURN ON) Load Emotes on Logical Server

KEEP THIS DISABLED

Causes the internal server to load your emotes instead of the client
If you enable this, emotes will only work in singleplayer.
emotecraft.otherconfig.autoFixEmoteStop: Auto patch emotes to stop smoothly
If the stopTick was left on default, Emotecraft will modify it to the last keyframe
Only checks JSON emotes
emotecraft.no_server: Server has no version of Emotecraft installed. Other users won't see your emotes if you play any.
emotecraft.different_server: Server has a different version of Emotecraft installed. Other users may not see your emotes play correctly.
emotecraft.otherconfig.quark.tooltip:
Highly unstable and not fully supported.

Using this is not recommended as it can cause odd results or even crash.
emotecraft.emote.author: Author:
emotecraft.blockedEmote: You are not allowed to play this emote.
emotecraft.resetConfig.title: Reset Emotecraft settings
emotecraft.resetConfig.message: Do you really want to reset your Emotecraft settings?
emotecraft.resetAllKeys.title: Reset all emote keybindings
emotecraft.resetAllKeys.message: Do you really want to reset your emote keybindings?
emotecraft.song_too_big_to_send: Song is too big to be sent to server. Sending emote only...
emotecraft.cant.override.forced: You're forced to play the current emote, it can't be changed.
